meanings.definition: A heterocyclic compound containing a five-membered ring with four carbon atoms and one sulfur atom.
meanings.sent1: The thiophene structure consists of four carbon atoms and one sulfur atom in a five-membered ring.
meanings.sent2: Chemists study the properties of thiophene due to its unique five-membered ring structure.
meanings.sent3: When the sulfur atom in thiophene went on vacation, the carbon atoms had to hold a meeting to figure out what to do.
meanings.sent4: The thiophene molecule is like a tiny circus tent with four carbon clowns and one sulfur acrobat.
meanings.sent5: In the world of molecules, thiophene stands out with its special five-membered ring featuring a sulfur atom.

meanings.definition: A colorless liquid with a strong odor, used in the production of various chemicals.
meanings.sent1: The workers handled the thiophene liquid carefully due to its strong odor.
meanings.sent2: Factories use thiophene in the production of different chemicals because of its properties.
meanings.sent3: The thiophene liquid's odor was so strong that even the nearby flowers wrinkled their petals.
meanings.sent4: The scent of thiophene filled the air like a powerful perfume in the factory.
meanings.sent5: The workers recognized the distinct smell of thiophene as soon as they entered the chemical plant.
